meanings.definition: Not renewed or restored to a previous state.
meanings.sent1: The old, unrenewed car sat in the garage for years.
meanings.sent2: The garden looked dreary and unrenewed after the long winter.
meanings.sent3: The unrenewed library book was finally returned with a layer of dust.
meanings.sent4: Her unrenewed enthusiasm for the project faded as time passed.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house had an unrenewed sense of loneliness about it.

meanings.sent1: After the long hike, his unrenewed energy left him exhausted.
meanings.sent2: The unrenewed plants in the dry soil desperately needed water.
meanings.sent3: The unrenewed coffee had gone cold in the forgotten mug.
meanings.sent4: Her unrenewed spirit needed a spark of inspiration to reignite.
meanings.sent5: The unrenewed forest lacked the vibrant colors of a healthy ecosystem.

meanings.definition: Not replaced with a new version or updated.
meanings.sent1: The unrenewed software was prone to bugs and glitches.
meanings.sent2: His unrenewed phone struggled to keep up with the latest apps.
meanings.sent3: The unrenewed contract still had outdated terms from years ago.
meanings.sent4: Her unrenewed wardrobe consisted of old, worn-out clothes.
meanings.sent5: The unrenewed technology was quickly becoming obsolete in the fast-paced industry.
